data.title: The Alabama Weather Blog
data.text:
Morning Beneficial Rains in Many Areas; Strong Storms over South Alabama

Showers and storms began forming over eastern Mississippi after midnight, moving east-northeast across Central Alabama by early morning, bringing beneficial rains to numerous counties. Later in the morning, additional storms developed in South Central Alabama, with temperatures ranging from the 70s in rain-cooled areas to the 80s in sunnier regions, and more showers expected in the afternoon and evening.

Read More

Saturday Morning Briefing Video: Unusually Wet Week Ahead for Alabama

Alabama is set to experience an unusually wet week with frequent showers and thunderstorms due to a persistent stationary front and broad troughing pattern. This increased rainfall will help moderate temperatures, keeping highs mostly in the 80s.

Read More

Occasional Showers/Storms Over The Weekend

RADAR CHECK: A number of showers and thunderstorms are in progress across Alabama this afternoon. Not raining everywhere, but the stronger storms are producing heavy rain and a good bit of lightning. With a limited amount of sun temperatures are only in the low to mid 80s across much of the state.

Read More

Alabama News Center — Alabama’s sales tax holiday this weekend is opportunity to save on school supplies and more

The 19th annual back-to-school sales tax holiday is this weekend, and parents are being encouraged to take advantage of the savings.

Read More

Midday Nowcast: Occasional Rain and Storms through the Weekend

Numerous showers and storms across Alabama today, and highs are holding in the upper 70s to low and mid 80s. As always in summer, rain distribution will be very uneven, feast or famine, meaning some locations could get too much, while other spots get nothing.

Read More

Alabama News Center — Abadir’s bakery in Greensboro, Alabama, fuses Egyptian, Southern flavors

A block behind the heart of Greensboro’s tiny downtown, a small cottage painted pine-tree green is flying a flag that whips in the wind before unfurling to proclaim, “Love each other.”

Read More

Elevated Rain Chances For Alabama Through Next Week

RADAR CHECK: Large areas of rain are moving through Alabama early this morning, and we continue to forecast occasional showers and thunderstorms today and tonight. With high precipitable water values, storms will be very efficient rain producers. Heavier storms will also be capable of producing strong gusty winds and lots of lightning.

Read More

Occasional Showers/Storms Through The Weekend

RADAR CHECK: Showers and thunderstorms continue to increase across Alabama this afternoon; heavier storms are producing strong, gusty winds and lots of lightning. The chance of showers will continue through tonight as an unstable airmass remains in place.

Read More

Midday Nowcast: Extreme Drought, but Higher Rain Chances

This week, all of the northern third of Alabama is suffering from at least moderate drought, with severe drought now covering large portions of the area.

Read More

Unsettled Pattern For Alabama Through Next Week

WET/UNSETTLED PATTERN AHEAD: We have a few spotty showers over North Alabama early this morning, but the main round of showers and storms will come in the 12 noon to 12 midnight time frame later today and tonight as an upper trough beats down the heat ridge.

Read More

Occasional Showers/Storms Through The Weekend

RADAR CHECK: We have scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms across Alabama this afternoon; some are producing torrential rain, strong winds, and lots of lighting. A few lingering showers are possible through the night; lows will be in the 70s.

Read More

Alabama News Center — Blue Ribbon Dairy in Tallassee, Alabama, offers customers more than just fresh milk

Tucked away in Tallassee is Blue Ribbon Dairy, a family-owned dairy farm that provides its customers with not only milk that’s straight from the cow to the jug in 24 hours, but the chance to see and experience the farm where that milk came from firsthand.

Read More

Midday Nowcast: Higher Rain Chances

Showers and storms will begin to increase in coverage through the rest of today as the air becomes more unstable, highs today are in the low to mid 90s.

Read More
